reviews.title: What
reviews.content:
A few days ago Nebula took up 400mb of space. Now it took up only 50.

HOW

reviews.title: Limited content, low streaming quality
reviews.content:
There is not much exclusive content, also the early content isn’t that early, many creators are leaving the platform such as kings and generals and hoog.
You can’t browse the content before subscribing and there isn’t a free trial.
Just stick with youtube.
Doesn’t worth a penny.

reviews.title: Bad Business Practices
reviews.content: Nebula uses predatory practices to lure you in. Even when only paying a few dollars to get a reading and bypassing the plan options, they still charge you the monthly fee after 5 day trial. Finding how to cancel subscription in app is purposely confusing. If you reach out to support with a problem they ignore you. And, the info/ readings I did try are incredibly basic. SCAM COMPANY

reviews.title: Not right for me.
reviews.content: I followed a few of my favorite content creators from Facebook over to nebula, I felt as though their content wasn’t much different than what they were presenting on YouTube or Facebook. I felt the community within nebula was not as expansive as YouTube obviously with good reason, but the reason I’m giving it two stars are the issues with compatibility I experienced with iPhone to the point where new videos would break the app and you could not watch older videos, and you had to restart the app. the latest news report on the attack on Iran causes my app to freeze. I think this is a cool concept and in the future would replace YouTube due to the level of content it does present. but I’m a stickler for ease of use.

reviews.title: Great videos terrible app
reviews.content: The app just doesn’t work well

reviews.title: Couldn’t Sign In with Apple
reviews.content: Not interested in managing more accounts and passwords. Add Sign In with Apple and I’ll be glad to sign up and subscribe.

reviews.title: From the Start
reviews.content: I’ve been with Nebula from the start of their existence. I’ve seen them grow and flourish. I watch it more than YouTube

reviews.title: Important and Cool
reviews.content:
Came because I was sick of YouTube and wanted the creators I like to have a better space to work in. Nebula gets talked about a bit and now I’m on it I like it better too. 
I’m actually writing this review because I have a couple thoughts as a user. 
One is that for a recovering YouTube user, nebula is actually somewhat difficult to get your foothold into when you first get it. Some more suggestion types or broader category tags on searches could help. 
Second, what about some articles? Plenty of creators probably have things they want to write, and this crowd of video viewers is more likely to read stuff.

reviews.title: Goated streaming service
reviews.content: Better then TikTok YouTube Netflix all of them

reviews.title: Podcasts no longer play in background when phone screen is off or app is in background.
reviews.content: Please fix. Thanks!

reviews.title: Great product but it needs a more fluid player.
reviews.content: Videos often just stop playing entirely when you simply hit the 10 second rewind.

reviews.title: Love the service, hate the apps
reviews.content: I don’t know why it’s so difficult in every interface to easily see the channels/creators I’ve subscribed to. Yes, there is a way, but it’s inconsistent and not prominent. iPad? Oh, it’s not on the Home Screen, it’s on a slide-out panel that doesn’t slide back in. Why isn’t new from you subscriptions the first row of thumbnails? Also, why do you make me scroll horizontally rather than wrapping the tiles?

reviews.title: Great content terrible app
reviews.content: While the content made by users of the app is great and I truly enjoy it the overall performance of the app is very disappointing. I would expect if you’re paying for a stream service it will at least let you play the videos but it constantly crashes, lags, the quality drops and it doesn’t let you fast forward on videos properly regardless of the wifi connection. I will continue to use it but if the problems persist I would cancel it and just wait until it improves.

reviews.title: A wonderful app
reviews.content: A video player that allows following and supporting some wonderful creators.  Excellent that there isn’t any embedded social media parts demanding engagement so I can consider and ponder what I’m watching in my own head then discuss with people I know instead of internet strangers.

reviews.title: Amazing content! (user interface needs work)
reviews.content:
I just wanna start by saying I LOVE Nebula! There are so many reasons that i appreciate this platform but thats not why I’m writing a review. I wanted to leave this review to give some feedback and suggestions regarding the user experience of navigating the mobile app.

I think the user interface is a seriously discouraging barrier  and for me, it is the main reason that I still use youtube as my primary source for video essay/info-tainment streaming.

The apps feels like it’s prioritizing promoting new creator content (which isn’t necessarily bad), while simultaneously making it less convenient for me to access the channels that i already follow and am specifically coming back to Nebula to watch. 

I think it would be a good idea to implement a primary page that functions similarly to the Youtube apps “subscriptions” page where you can scroll through a mixed feed of content produced by the creators that I’m already following and know I like. 

Having both a “Home” and “Explore” page just seems redundant to me. They both primarily function to promote new content, but while the Home page is incredibly legible and engaging from a design point of view, the Explore page is super bland. 

Also when i turn off my phone screen so i can just listen to the videos, they tend to randomly pause. Seems like a bug

reviews.title: Nebula
reviews.content: It is very good thanks to jet lag and man carrying thing

reviews.title: Feature requests
reviews.content: Nebula is quite nice, but there’s some small things I wish it had. I have no idea how hard these features would be to implement from a technical perspective. 1. More than 2x speed. YouTube doesn’t have this, but i often use an extension. 2. Video chapters with segmented timeline.

reviews.title: Horrible App;Decent Content;Luxury
reviews.content:
This app is a luxury I pay for simply because I can afford to give more financial support to some of my favorite creators without having to have several individual Patreon, etc. subscriptions.

The UI is sluggish and the playback options are worse than minimal (non-existent). I should at minimum be able to manually select video quality and adjust subtitles.

This is not an app able or seemingly even attempting to replace YouTube. Many of the creators on Nebula don’t make Nebula exclusive content, the same videos are simply ad-free with a a one-second Nebula splash screen somewhere in the video. Nebula originals are only worth paying for if you’re looking to support a specific set of content creators you already follow closely.

If you’re able to afford YouTube premium and aren’t interested in the niche and quickly exhausted Originals, do that instead. If you have some extra  money lying around and don’t mind paying to give your favorite creators a little more money per view, subscribe for a month and see.

reviews.title: Inconvenient
reviews.content:
I absolutely hate how my subscriptions (or whatever Nebula has renamed it to) is so hard to access. Just face it, there’s not as much content on this platform. No one is subscribing to Nebula unless they are trying to support the creators they would otherwise watch on YouTube. So stop pushing so hard the unrelated content I don’t care about on the front page. Beneath the giant hero image that displays the same content every time I open it, there’s a scrolling section of the latest videos uploaded to the entire platform. Why? As I said before, none of this content is relevant to me, and it also shows how little content there really is here, as it makes it clear there’s just not many uploads happening on any given day.

This is how I use Nebula: I watch YouTube. When I see an upload by someone who I know posts to Nebula, I’ll go there to watch it instead.  Oh wait, the front page is only irrelevant stuff. Where is subscriptions…oh right it’s called library. Go to library. Oh, I can only see 1.5 thumbnails in this view, with links to random other unused features. How to see all of the videos of my subscriptions in one place… must be “Followed Channels”. Oops, no, that’s just a static aphabetical list of the channels, with no way to sort by activity. Go back to the previous screen. Hmmm where is the right button…oh right that tiny low contrast “view more” that is barely noticable. NOW I can see the content I’m actually subscribing for.

I probably would have just saved time by tapping next on the ads on the YouTube app.

reviews.title: Good Content; Poor Navigation
reviews.content: Really good content overall and a great way to support creators. The only reason for a middle ground score is that I find navigation  to get back to creators and content I am already engaging with unintuitive or too reply buried. The app does a fair job of new content suggestions.

reviews.title: Good
reviews.content: Good

reviews.title: Get it, you won’t regret it
reviews.content: If you follow at least two people on here, stop thinking about it and just subscribe. You won’t regret it. Make sure to use a creator code for a discount. Customer service is great and there are no gimmicks. One of my favorite services that I own.

reviews.title: My favorite streaming service
reviews.content: I love the community that Nebula fosters. The creators on Nebula are amazing. The streaming service application works better than AAA companies. I tell everyone how awesome Nebula is.

reviews.title: Would give 5-stars, but no comment section
reviews.content: All in the title. The app is the primary way in which I consume Nebula content, and I want to be able to discuss with the community/respond to my favorite creators!

reviews.title: Nebula is essential
reviews.content:
The Nebula video service is everything YouTube & every other hosting service could have been had they respected creators & viewers. 
Nebula is a subscription based video hosting service built from scratch by a group of YouTube creators who knew what YouTube's weaknesses were and how to make a better home for their productions. 

No Ads! High resolution, fast, and incredibly diverse creators - try Nebula & you will be hooked!

reviews.title: Excellent content, no middleman
reviews.content:
I am happy to support the creators I enjoy like Tale Foundry, PhilosophyTube, and Jacob Geller more directly, and especially on a platform where they can produce content that advertisers would never allow. 

Politicalized topics that get censored on other platforms.Long-form rambling that performs bad on YouTube’s algorithm but is perfect for my long working hours. Even something as simple as being able to use a copyrighted song that is crucial to the thematic core of a piece of art (such as is examined in Geller’s video on Immortality, “The Single Best Gaming Moment of 2022”) makes Nebula worth the very, very affordable price. 

Check it out, find a few creators you love, then know you are directly supporting more of their work.

reviews.title: Support Issues from the Start - Not fully functional with iOS
reviews.content: I downloaded and subscribed, but my phone will not AirPlay Nebula to my Apple TV. I emailed support. Got no response for a few days, then sent a follow up email and got two responses this morning with my emails quoted and a single sentence that says my issue has been merged with another ticket number but no further explanation. Not sure what I’m paying for if I can’t cast to my TV. Really disappointed.

reviews.title: Sort/filter
reviews.content:
Any possibility y’all could add a sort/filter option for played/unplayed videos on the creator video lists?

Love the content, keep it coming.

reviews.title: Videos struggle to play
reviews.content: Very nice app and good content, I am happy with my relatively cheap subscription. The videos, however, seem to struggle to play pretty often. Even when I have a really good internet connection they seem to freeze for long periods of time. This issue seems to have gotten a lot worse recently and so hopefully it can be fixed soon.

reviews.title: Too political
reviews.content: Recently started hosting a lot of far left shows with no counterbalance

reviews.title: I love nebula!
reviews.content:
It lets the creators I enjoy make the content they want to!
The creators get to use all the words they need to but are sometimes barred from using.
Back and forward 10 seconds was added too and it’s great! 
Hopefully more creators who are currently stuck on other platforms will move here :D
Worth the price and I definitely recommend Nebula especially if you actually want to support creators works and creativity.

reviews.title: Great Company and Morals
reviews.content: Very Helpful and Moral Company, it was a great service used it for a year forgot about the subscription and when it renewed they helped me refund vastly with no difficulty. Highly recommend both the service and the Company.

reviews.title: Based
reviews.content: On factual evidence

reviews.title: Not worth 7 bucks a month for the content
reviews.content: Nebula has a pitifully small number of  channels. 300 channels and 175 creators, many, perhaps most, who post the same content on YouTube. It's sad.

reviews.title: Jet Lag but more
reviews.content: New subscriber, but I love the ad free, early Jet Lag episodes. Big fan of the Layover podcast as well. All of the other ad free content has been awesome too.

reviews.title: YouTube is preferable
reviews.content: Messy app, poor playback, unable to search for specific videos by creators I am looking for, waste of seven bucks

reviews.title: Works great
reviews.content: Just needs better search and video bookmarking organization

reviews.title: Worth it even after just 3 days
reviews.content:
Finally followed a link from a favorite binge watch channel and got a year for $36. Honestly will be getting the lifetime subscription when this one runs out.

It’s great to get uncensored and extra content- I also weirdly love non- algorithm bait titles. It gives me a much better idea of what I’m about to watch.

reviews.title: Review
reviews.content: Garbage content

reviews.title: Love the creators, playback not so much.
reviews.content: Try scrubbing a video forward or backward more than 5 minutes and it completely breaks the playback. I have to close out of the app and re-open it to get it working again.

reviews.title: 100% worth it
reviews.content: High quality indy films game shows and journalists. Very cool

reviews.title: Trouble moving around videos
reviews.content: When I fast forward or rewind through videos the app often simply stops and stops working. Watching the video straight through works but trying to fast forward or rewind to where i left off on a video or to a certain spot to rewatch is difficult.

reviews.title: App isn’t great
reviews.content: I appreciate what nebula is trying to do, but the app still has huge problems even though it’s been years since release. Technical Issues: -Audio breaks randomly and you have to force close and reopen the app. -Picture in Picture breaks, and you have to force close. -The app accumulates large amounts of data over time for some unknown reason, and you have to either delete and reinstall or use their reset option in the iphone settings for nebula. Other minor annoyance: -Channels have links to youtube videos instead of the nebula links in descriptions. Also, the whole debacle with Glenwood Caverns was really embarrassing, and really makes me question the goals of the platform along with the people running it.

reviews.title: VERY bias - Left wing content
reviews.content:
I used to love Nebula. You could always find interesting content about random things. Over the last year the content has been completely overruled by left-wing creators that push left-wing messages. 

if political content is approved to be published here, it should be equal and fair - or left off. I come hear to learn about history, how things are built…etc. 

The creators on here (or the editors that let them publish) have gone too far. Won’t be renewing.

reviews.title: Better
reviews.content: Far better than YouTube, especially for educational content.

reviews.title: Add Video queue
reviews.content: Very good app, but I video queue is needed.

reviews.title: B.S
reviews.content: I hate this! This was gonna be a fun little social media for me to use but it needs a freaking subscription just to use! If you want to earn money then just make the subscription a premium feature and then maybe the app will be a little better, but I don’t know that because there is no way I am paying for a social media app because there are so much more free, and good social media apps out there.

reviews.title: it was supposed to be $36 annually, but I was only offered $60
reviews.content: annoy

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.content: So great to watch a lot of my favorite creators work with out YouTube jank

reviews.title: Great but has one big flaw
reviews.content:
A lot of the reviews on here seem to be from a year or two ago and I wanted to give my two cents as someone who just got Nebula.

All in all I quite enjoy the app and am prime audience for the platform since I enjoyed a lot of the creators on the platform and am already finding new ones I like.

Additionally I find the lack of ads fantastic, I’ve had no problems getting the app or MiniPlayer to work and the search feature works as intended.  I like being able to “subscribe” to content creators the way one would on YouTube and the vast array of content is great.

Now some problems I am having is the subtitles of videos are often wrong saying words the creators aren’t saying or even having a line of dialogue repeat even if the creator has moved on.

Additionally, even though Nebula is ad free— the ads creators place in their videos for when they get released on YouTube is still there.  Something that frankly is a silly thing to complain about but definitely impacts the experience.  I’m not paying for YouTube so I’m completely fine if a creator puts their ad for helix sleep in there.  I’m less fine with it in a paid subscription service and it robs the experience of a documentary/video essay streaming service making it feel like YouTube.

All in all, I love the idea and the lack of ads for my videos I like to watch is worth it but I wish there was more of a distinction between Nebula and YouTube because as it currently stands the platform feels like a mass patreon for YouTubers I like rather than anything of substantial merit.  Getting my videos ad free and early justify the price in my eyes but I can’t help but think about the fact that even on a paid platform I’m still having to fast forward through a patreon plug or a audible advertisement.

reviews.title: A great video platform
reviews.content: Support independent creators by subscribing to Nebula. So many quality creators you know, or knew from YouTube.  Come to this ad-free platform of extended content and content you won’t find on YouTube!

reviews.title: Good service with a couple of nitpicks
reviews.content:
Neat service, appreciate the more direct support for the creators, mostly works pretty well.
Has occasional issues when I move it to the background for a while, then when I reopen it the video refuses to start playing again until I close it and reopen.

I would also appreciate a more clear way to refresh the latest updates or watch later lists.

reviews.title: No ads, all my favorite educational creators.
reviews.content: I paid for the lifetime membership, and I’ve been finding many of my favorite educational content creators, which is a joy, knowing I can be free of the political ads or ads for games that are borderline p*** that plague YouTube when I want to learn things.

reviews.title: Great creators, lovely videos. buggy app
reviews.content: Love the creators and the videos. Hate how buggy the app is. If your video app hates scrubbing I don’t know what to tell ya.

reviews.title: Review
reviews.content: Lots of good content but I wish there was a better/longer recommended list

reviews.title: Great service
reviews.content: If you not watching Jet Lag what are you doing?

reviews.title: Yet another platform that tells you what to watch
reviews.content:
I love many of the creators. The app itself is well-written. The problem? The algorithm.

It’s bad enough that the Home tab is full of stuff they want you to watch, rather than anything you yourself have chosen. 

Fine. I’ll tap the Library tab EVERY TIME I USE THE APP. But then it just shows one row of the latest episodes you want to see. Tap again to see a vertical list. So now two taps just to get to what you wanted. 

But, oh, that’s not enough! No, now they shove Dracula’s Ex-Girlfriend in *your library* even though you never selected it. AND YOU CANNOT REMOVE IT OR HIDE IT. It is there forever, like the time Apple shoved that U2 album down everybody’s throat. Ugh. 

“But you’re used to this: Facebook and Instagram and Twitter/X and TikTok all do this!”, they say. Ah, true, but I PAY FOR NEBULA. I don’t pay for those. I am the customer if I pay for it. Aren’t I? I guess not. 

But wait, there’s more. If you just accept the default Home tab, then it invariably shows you lots of war (“Modern Conflict”) and total Climate destruction (“Jet Lag The Game” and “The Getaway”). What could be more fun than killing people and flying and driving hundreds or thousands of miles —for a game. Completely tone deaf. 

I won’t be renewing.

reviews.title: Leftist justification app
reviews.content: If you are looking for a leftist app that works like a perfect echo chamber then this is the app for you. A bunch of Johnny Harris wannabe’s will explain everyday issues with a twinge of snark and arrogance.

reviews.title: Growing bigger & better
reviews.content: A great supplement to YouTube for viewers who follow top creators of informative content. I like that the interface has grown faster and added features such as download for offline viewing; plus, the library has grown steadily.

reviews.title: Love nebula
reviews.content: Great creators, love it.

reviews.title: Real cool
reviews.content: Lots of good videos separate from all the YouTube slop

reviews.title: Please make it free I'm broke
reviews.content: I am broke just make it free so I can have it for free🫡

reviews.title: Great channels, lackluster interface
reviews.content: Nebula has many of my favorite channels, and allows me to support these financially channels with minimal cost to myself. On the other hand, the UX is extremely lacking and the watch later playlist, which I use extensively, is nearly unusable compared to YouTube’s implementation. There is no way to sort the playlist, where youtube offers several options, particularly “sort by last added”. The final blow to the watch later is that autoplay doesn’t respect it. Finishing a video in watch later results in Nebula auto playing some (possible) related video, as opposed to the next in watch later. this requires the user to close the video on completion, remove it watch later, then select the next video in the (unsorted) list.

reviews.title: Good content
reviews.content: Good content and smooth UI. Just now my video froze though, keep pushing on platform updates.

reviews.title: Disguises ads as notifications
reviews.content: Forces you to receive push ads for series or channels that you’ve never watched. Does not respect your privacy or your time.

reviews.title: Great content, app itself needs work
reviews.content:
The content on Nubula is great and well worth the subscription fee. The app, however, has some bugs. One prominent issue is particular videos failing to play. One video will stop in the middle and refuse to play, even after app restarts. Other videos will play just fine.

Another issue is constantly disappearing downloads. If you download a few videos for offline watching later, they will disappear one-by-one after a few hours. Why is it happening? No error messages to be found.

reviews.title: Da bes
reviews.content: I love it.

reviews.title: Amazing content
reviews.content: I love the creators on nebula. They have amazing content and paying one fee to get all their material add free is so worth it.

reviews.title: Waste of $5, very limited topics
reviews.content:
There's no free trial option to see if you like it so I was reluctant to try but gave it a shot anyway to see how it was. Now I feel like I flushed a fiver down the toilet. There were some creators I already enjoy on the platform and I guess you get earlier access to their videos than you do on YouTube but honestly that's not a huge priority for me. As a test I searched a popular fitness topic that has has a lot of history and religion and philosophy behind it, yoga. There wasn't a single video. Nothing from a fitness instructor, nothing about the history of yoga in India and how it came to the Anglosphere, etc. all the results I got were for Baby Yoda or Baba Yaga. I didn't bother looking further, just cancelled my subscription and deleted the app. If it can't attract even one fitness instructor or non-Western historian to the service after 12 years I don't think it's worth the cost. At least YouTube, for all its flaws, has those. I could have probably tried a few more topics like music lessons or car repair but I suspect I'd get similar results 

It does do picture-in-picture and background play which is ok I guess

reviews.title: A Reasonable Assessment
reviews.content:
Though the application is still young, the lack of a an algorithm provides a unique experience in the streaming world. Especially because it allows the viewer to seek knowledge beyond the confines of any previously established bubbles of thought or doctrine. 

If the app improves (which there is always room for improvement) I will write a more extensive review. 

(As of 07/24/24)

reviews.title: You need better user interface
reviews.content:
You need a subscriptions tab to make it easier to get to your followed creators.

I shouldn’t have to type “Glidus” or “Alt Shift X” every time I go on the app

reviews.title: Bad first impression
reviews.content: I downloaded this app an hour ago and it’s been practically unusable. I am using the app to cast the video. It took a minute just to connect to the cast, probably five minutes to load the video I’m currently trying to watch, switched inexplicably to another video while I was watching, and has now hit a point where the video is buffering every 30 seconds. It’s looking pretty likely that this will be a one and done subscription. How on earth does this have 4.7 stars?

reviews.title: Excellent content, app is silk.
reviews.content: Buttery smooth, high quality streaming, low resource usage.

reviews.title: Great Content, Difficult Platform
reviews.content: I love the concept of Nebula as a service, I enjoy the output of most of the creators and think the exclusive content on offer is very worthwhile. I want to love Nebula as a platform that empowers its creators and can give the audience more, but the issues I’ve run into with the app have made it difficult to consistently enjoy. The primary source of my issues has been with the podcast feature of the app, as I will often be listening to a podcast before it stops for a couple of minutes for seemingly no reason. Even me closing and reopening the app won’t get the podcast going again which ends up just causing me to use another app for podcasts while I drive or work. Sometimes I’ll download podcast episodes since I do a lot of traveling, only for me to open the app before my flight to find out all of my downloads have disappeared (despite me making sure they were downloaded the night before). The inconsistency with the podcast functions has been frustrating to say the least, as it has been easier to just listen to the content elsewhere than continue to engage with an app I desperately want to enjoy using.

reviews.title: Like My Favorite Creators but In Video Ads Stink and App Needs Work
reviews.content:
Good content, but the whole reason I signed up was to avoid ads, yet more and more creators are including in video advertisements.

Also the app needs work to make it smoother. Biggest examples would be queueing videos and playlists.

reviews.title: Excellent media platform
reviews.content: Curated educational and cultural content. Your favorite creators in one place. Beats YouTube every day.

reviews.title: Amazing way to support my favorite creators!
reviews.content:
Nebula is the only streaming platform I pay for, and I love it! The creators on here are excellently curated, and I can click on pretty much any video and watch it all the way through. I also love how this platform also focuses on having queer, PoC, and other diverse voices, allowing them to create content that wouldn't be possible on something like YouTube. And there are so many creators I already watch on here, like Tale Foundry, Jessie Gender, Big Joel, Bright Sun Films, Kat Blaque, Hbomberguy, and surprisingly enough, Todd in the Shadows? 

If you see a creator you follow on here and want to support them, I 100% urge you to subscribe. The rest of the content, even from the people you don't know, is sure to be just as good.

reviews.title: Horrible app
reviews.content:
With the focus being on selling more subscription and making Nebula available on more platforms, this app is completely neglected and is a better YouTube Premium advocate than anyone. 

First of all, you can download videos for offline viewing, which is great, right? Well, guess what? The app often loses the downloaded content for no reason at all and you can literally see the downloaded videos just suddenly disappear right before your eyes when you need them the most. 

Second, the TV app is also terrible. After you have scrolled down on a creator's video feed, what do you expect when you hit the back button? It should be the previous page. But not this app. It scrolls back up instead as "back" means undo. 

Finally, the UI/UX is simply messy and very unfriendly. There's no way to hide videos from a channel from being recommended. There's no good way to explore creators or videos similar to what you like. The server is extremely slow and it often hangs and doesn't load quickly (it's not the connection). 

Anyway, this app makes me wanna use YouTube Premium more than anything else.

reviews.title: I support my creators
reviews.content: I have watched most of the creators in this platform for years before Nebula. Allowing them to have some more freedom and produce what they want outside of YouTube’s circle is a cause I support. Keep up the great work over there

reviews.title: High quality content
reviews.content: Great high quality videos from some of my favorite YouTubers

reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY
reviews.content: Videos won’t play. I’m extremely disappointed in Nebula.

reviews.title: I’m glad for this!
reviews.content: So far, not disappointed. I love that I am able to listen to new series and a diverse collection of my old YouTube follow list without the need of adds and sponsorship plugs (not that I blame any creator for that) :). Glad to pay the money!

reviews.title: If you ask for a rating you get one star.
reviews.content: Focus on the product and maybe you’ll get a rating better.

reviews.title: Terrible
reviews.content: I tried to make an account and first my password was not good then when I try entering a new one I just freeze and won’t let me go any further

reviews.title: Can’t control video quality
reviews.content: The app doesn’t allow you to configure the video quality

reviews.title: Mostly just podcasts that use lots of data
reviews.content: With the exception of a couple of great creators (like Grady Hillhouse) who really use the video medium to make their explanations clearer, the vast majority of nebula video is either irrelevant stock images, or just a camera pointed at a talking person.

reviews.title: Bittersweet
reviews.content: Fantastic content. The OS needs work, content doesn’t load well, OS is clunky, podcasts can’t play while app is closed.

reviews.title: Love the Content But…
reviews.content: The App always has issues. I was watched a video and wanted to go back a bit on the Shuttle video and it’s not possible. Tried quoting the app and still prevents me from scrubbing back a min or so. Frustrating basic features just don’t work consistently. I keep paying to support the content but honestly use YouTube which is I guess the point then my money supports content and costs are down as streaming here is bad. I just wish the Nebula exclusives I could watch and not be frustrated.

reviews.title: Way better than Youtube and other streaming services!
reviews.content: This app works fairly well. It is significantly cheaper than most other streaming platforms, and includes enough content to keep people entertained. No ads, captioning on all videos, and the ability to download any video, among other features, makes this well worth it.

reviews.title: Good but lacks some useful features
reviews.content: I like the experience on Nebula but the app could use some extra features. Primarily a playlist function would be great and perhaps a more relevant-to-me front page or easier to use way to mark videos I've seen elsewhere as watched. I’m glad nebula allows mini-player on iPad and iPhone. Overall a great way to watch videos.

reviews.title: Jet Lag Best
reviews.content: Jet Lag brought me in, but tons of other cool stuff👍

reviews.title: The app of my dreams
reviews.content: This is what I hoped YouTube would be. Engrossing content without the censorship or ads or other bull.  In other words: my favorite content creators unemped, able to show their full artistic glory.  I love it.

reviews.title: Cool concept
reviews.content: Didn’t actually get to use it, cause i met the pay wall. honestly i don’t know what i was expecting. i’m sure it’s a good app though

reviews.title: Well streamlined, excellent app
reviews.content:
Simple, easy to use, downloadable content for when you’re out of signal range, great content creators, no ads.

Love it.

reviews.title: So many missing features for such a price.
reviews.content:
1- can’t change video quality manually on the ios app
2-can’t even rewind the video from a certain point which is ridiculous.
3-downloaded videos are terrible in terms of sound and quality…
Just why?

reviews.title: GREAT APP 10/10 - WATCH ‘JET LAG THE GAME’!!!!
reviews.content: Wonderful app, jetlag/crimespree are worth the price alone. Been subscribed to nebula off and on for several years, ever since the early Wendy docs (I vaguely remember watching St Helena and Ketchikan at different points early on if that helps). Finally binged jetlag last month and idk why I hadn’t sooner, truly amazing they’ve made such a high quality travel program despite being filmed by a few youtube zoomers with iphone gimbals and whatever gear they happen to have stuffed in their backpacks. Also love NEO, RLL’s “modern conflicts”, Maggie Mae Fish’s David Lynch podcast and too many more to name.

reviews.title: Love supporting creators but would love comments for creator interaction
reviews.content: Overall steaming quality is excellent. I feel if comments were enabled the quality of discourse and community interaction would be high on nebula

reviews.title: I hate your face
reviews.content: Your content creators faces will be your downfall.

reviews.title: Fraudulent Charges
reviews.content: I downloaded the app to see what it was and it automatically signed me up for a subscription and charged me for months without my knowledge. Looked it up, apparently this is a common problem people have with the app.

reviews.title: much better than youtube! one small issue. . .
reviews.content:
I don’t generally leave reviews, but I dearly love this app and I so want it to thrive. Nebula has a great selection and I love that you can use PiP and play videos with your screen off. I just have one small suggestion for usability that might improve things slightly. Whenever you try to scrub to the middle of videos or any specific timestamp that isn’t within the first ten seconds of the time you are attempting to play from, the video freezes. You can’t play it the video without restarting the app completely and retrying a few times. 

Again, I really love this app and I believe it’s well worth the subscription, but this issue is a bit of a hassle especially for people who watch videos at staggered intervals or have a specific section of a video they want to revisit.
